title: Whangārei
summary: Whangārei (Māori: [faŋaːˈɾɛi]) is the northernmost major city in New Zealand and the regional capital of Northland Region. It is also the largest city in the Northland Region. It is part of the Whangarei District, a local body created in 1989 from the former Whangarei City, Whangarei County and Hikurangi Town councils, to administer both the city proper and its hinterland. The city population was estimated to be 54,300 in June 2021,[2] an increase from 47,000 in 2001.
